cons: None that I can think of

pros: Working at CIEE had provided me a great opportunity in developing new skills and experience in educational work.
cons: The current management team doesn't seem to care much about education but rather on the profit of the organization even though CIEE was branded as a non-profit organization.

pros: Awesome experience being placed overseas. They sent a Lonely Planet book prior to departure and had an orientation to ensure I didn't start teaching without any experience at all.
cons: Once you're overseas, you're pretty much on your own because the CIEE folks are located in the major cities while most teachers are placed in remote locations. The alumni network is mediocre at best because many of the teachers placed overseas are mediocre at best. Only on occasion does CIEE attract people who genuinely want to teach and the rest of the employees are wanderlusting, postgrads who couldn't lock down a full-time job.

review_title: Abroad Teacher in Thailand for CIEE
job_title: ESL Teacher In Thailand in Lampang
pros: Organization amazing to work under. The customer service was incredible. If I ever needed help people would respond in a timely manner. Everyone was very positive. I loved teaching for a school that they helped find for me.
cons: Everything was amazing. I have nothing negative to say about them.

pros:
-working in a foreign country and experiencing a different culture
- program facilitation - makes taking the leap much easier
cons:
- expensive program
- not guaranteed certain pay - based on the school you're placed at
